thread.title: Discovery, HGTV and Food Network Prep for a Skinny TV Bundle as Merger Closes

author: Keach Hagey
title: Discovery, HGTV and Food Network Prep for a Skinny TV Bundle as Merger Closes

organizations.name: food network prep for a skinny tv bundle

text:
“Shark Week” and “Chopped” could soon be available as part of a new skinny bundle of channels in the U.S. for as little as $6 a month, following the merger of the networks’ parent companies.
Discovery Communications Inc.’s $11.9 billion acquisition of Scripps Networks Interactive Inc., which is expected to close Tuesday, will create a nonfiction programming powerhouse of 18 cable networks, including HGTV, Discovery, TLC and Food Network. 
... RELATED VIDEO Cutting Cable: Often Smarter, Not Always Cheaper The latest internet video services such as YouTube TV, Hulu and Sling TV promise to stream all the live TV you could want, cheaper and easier than cable. WSJ's David Pierce tests the services, and does the math. Photo/Video: Emily Prapuolenis/The Wall Street Journal To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
